intro: Scandix laevigata, commonly known as the smooth scabweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Scandix laevigata is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
